intro: Phyllostegia multiflora, commonly known as the broad-leaf phyllostegia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks. Phyllostegia multiflora is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and support local wildlife.
